title: iQOO 13 launch date revealed
description: The iQOO 13 will be launching in India on December 5, a new rumor claims. It's unclear if this will count as its international launch, and also if it will be unveiled in China ahead of that date. The iQOO 13 will sport BOE's Q10 display, the Chinese panel maker's latest and greatest, with 2K resolution, 144 Hz refresh rate, as well as higher brightness, a longer lifespan, lower color deviation, and lower power consumption than competing options. There will also be an ultrasonic in-display fingerprint sensor. iQOO 12 The phone will be powered by the upcoming Snapdragon 8 Elite...
excerpt: It's coming in the next few weeks. The iQOO 13 will be launching in India on December 5, a new rumor claims. It's unclear if this will count as its...
text: The iQOO 13 will be launching in India on December 5, a new rumor claims. It's unclear if this will count as its international launch, and also if it will be unveiled in China ahead of that date. The iQOO 13 will sport BOE's Q10 display, the Chinese panel maker's latest and greatest, with 2K resolution, 144 Hz refresh rate, as well as higher brightness, a longer lifespan, lower color deviation, and lower power consumption than competing options. There will also be an ultrasonic in-display fingerprint sensor. iQOO 12The phone will be powered by the upcoming Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, paired with up to 16GB of RAM and up to 512GB of storage, and should have a trio of 50 MP cameras on the back (main, ultrawide, telephoto), as well as a massive 6,150 mAh battery with support for 100W wired charging. Over in India, it's rumored to start at around INR 55,000 (about $653 or €597 at the current exchange rates). Source
html:
The iQOO 13 will be launching in India on December 5, a new rumor claims. It's unclear if this will count as its international launch, and also if it will be unveiled in China ahead of that date.

The iQOO 13 will sport BOE's Q10 display, the Chinese panel maker's latest and greatest, with 2K resolution, 144 Hz refresh rate, as well as higher brightness, a longer lifespan, lower color deviation, and lower power consumption than competing options. There will also be an ultrasonic in-display fingerprint sensor.

iQOO 12

The phone will be powered by the upcoming Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, paired with up to 16GB of RAM and up to 512GB of storage, and should have a trio of 50 MP cameras on the back (main, ultrawide, telephoto), as well as a massive 6,150 mAh battery with support for 100W wired charging. Over in India, it's rumored to start at around INR 55,000 (about $653 or €597 at the current exchange rates).

Source
